billionaires.title: Billionaire Quotes
billionaires.subtitle: Who said what?
billionaires.question: I mean the truth is, I've never had it so good in terms of taxes. I am paying the lowest tax rate that I've ever paid in my life.
billionaires.response_post: said this. In today’s dire economy, wealth taxes paid by the super-rich only accounts for 4% of all tax revenue while tax paid by everyday people accounts for close to 80%! Governments can rectify this inequality by deciding to #TaxTheRich.

food.title: Food
food.subtitle: Skipping Meals?
food.question: In recent months, how much more are you spending on food?
food.response: A hard truth to swallow is that as households are increasingly struggling to keep up with food prices, some of the world’s largest food and energy companies increased their profits by 256% in 2022 during the cost-of-living crisis, we must #SurvivalOfTheRichest

energy.title: Energy
energy.subtitle: Taking Cold Showers?
energy.question: In recent months, how much more are you spending on energy* (electricity, heat, fuel)?
energy.response: As individuals like yourself pay higher pump & utility prices, food and energy companies have made $ 306 billion in windfall profits in 2022. Oxfam’s report has found a growing body of evidence that points to corporate profits and margins as a significant driver of greed-inflation. #FightInequality

qol.title: Quality of life
qol.subtitle: Are you penny pinching?
qol.question: Due to the rising cost of living, what have you had to sacrifice to survive?
qol.response: It comes as no surprise that Billionaires have sacrificed nothing. Since 2020 their wealth has increased by $2.7bn a day. While the cost of food expected to increase by 18%in 2022, luxury goods such as yachts, champagne & thoroughbreds have only increased by 7%. #TaxTheRich

wages.title: Wages
wages.subtitle: Earning a liveable wage?
wages.question: Has your wage decreased since the pandemic began?

responses.Yes: You are well within the majority of humanity that has experienced a decrease in income or loss of employment but the richest 1% have snatched-up almost twice as much wealth as the rest of the world combined since 2020. We must fight inequality by demanding #SurvivalOfTheRichest
responses.No: At least 1.7 billion people live in countries where inflation is outpacing wage growth, thus you’re inadvertently experiencing a real-terms pay cut which will in turn drive-up inequality and poverty. #FightInequality

tax.title: Tax
tax.subtitle: Abolish billionaires today!
tax.question: In your every day life, when do you pay taxes?
tax.response: Billionaires continue to stealthily avoid taxes by investing in assets that accrue value and increase their overall wealth without being subject to taxation, not to mention the easy access to tax havens globally. A #WealthTax is long overdue to #fightinequality
